1.text: A wise son—the instruction of a father, And a scorner—he hath not heard rebuke.

2.text: From the fruit of the mouth a man eateth good, And the soul of the treacherous—violence.

3.text: Whoso is keeping his mouth, is keeping his soul, Whoso is opening wide his lips—ruin to him!

4.text: The soul of the slothful is desiring, and hath not. And the soul of the diligent is made fat.

5.text: A false word the righteous hateth, And the wicked causeth abhorrence, and is confounded.

6.text: Righteousness keepeth him who is perfect in the way, And wickedness overthroweth a sin offering.

7.text: There is who is making himself rich, and hath nothing, Who is making himself poor, and wealth is abundant.

8.text: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches, And the poor hath not heard rebuke.

9.text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth, And the lamp of the wicked is extinguished.

10.text: A vain man through pride causeth debate, And with the counselled is wisdom.

11.text: Wealth from vanity becometh little, And whoso is gathering by the hand becometh great.

12.text: Hope prolonged is making the heart sick, And a tree of life is the coming desire.

13.text: Whoso is despising the Word is destroyed for it, And whoso is fearing the Command is repayed.

14.text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, To turn aside from snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding giveth grace, And the way of the treacherous is hard.

16.text: Every prudent one dealeth with knowledge, And a fool spreadeth out folly.

17.text: A wicked messenger falleth into evil, And a faithful ambassador is healing.

18.text: Whoso is refusing instruction—poverty and shame, And whoso is observing reproof is honoured.

19.text: A desire accomplished is sweet to the soul, And an abomination to fools is: Turn from evil.

20.text: Whoso is walking with wise men is wise, And a companion of fools suffereth evil.

21.text: Evil pursueth sinners, And good recompenseth the righteous.

22.text: A good man causeth sons’ sons to inherit, And laid up for the righteous is the sinner’s wealth.

23.text: Abundance of food—the tillage of the poor, And substance is consumed without judgment.

24.text: Whoso is sparing his rod is hating his son, And whoso is loving him hath hastened him chastisement.

25.text: The righteous is eating to the satiety of his soul, And the belly of the wicked lacketh!
